result.execSummary:
The defendant Deguan L Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances without prescription. Random UA's. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Employment to the limit as set by social security so benefits are not affected. Defendant must maintain a residence in the state of Wisconsin. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing.  Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Defendant does not plan on seeking postconviction relief.

Defendant Deguan L Brown in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Deguan L Brown in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense indicates that deft has plead and was prepared to go to sentencing. Defense was under the assumption that deft could transfer the probation to IL. Defense indicates that deft now has a Wisconsin address and would like to reinstate the plea that was withdrawn previously and go to sentencing. The State recommends 1 yr probation.

BTC: Defendant may reinstate the plea. Deft found guilty due to plea on 7/15 being reinstated. Sent w/held - 1 yr probation/CFTS

Return to sender - Attempted not known; unable to forward. NOH/Deguan Brown
Return to sender - Attempted not known; unable to forward. BBF notice.

DEFENDANT POSTED $200.00 ON APRIL 1, 2015. Ct 1: 961.41(3g)(e)-PCS/THC - 2nd & Subsequent.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Status conference on July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deguan L Brown in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Deguan L Brown in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State agrees to modify bond to $1000.00 cash if deft changes his plea today. Upon plea to charge, the State recommends 1 yr probation and agrees not to issue BJ charges.

Parties agree to waive PSI. The Court will not transfer probation to Illinois so the defendant does not wish to change his plea at this time and wishes to withdraw the plea as entered.

The State is asking for $2,500.00 cash bond. 

BTC: Vacate warrant/reinstate bond. Guilty as above. Parties agree to waive PSI. The defendant withdraws his plea and the Court vacates plea and finding of guilt.
          Cash bond to be set at $1000.00. Same terms and conditions remain  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
